metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11334 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The address_space_write_continue function in exec.c in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) allows local guest OS privileged users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access and guest instance crash) by leveraging use of qemu_map_ram_ptr to access guest ram block area.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11334` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> second commit doesn't look right, lock variable used in dma field, needs more investigation  This issue caused a regression for Xen users, and was reverted in USN 3575-2. Since this is a low-severity issue, we are not going to include it in a subsequent update.

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
